subabsurdus: <entryFree id="n45748" type="main" key="su^babsurdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-absurdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rather absurd</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">sunt illa subabsurda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subabsurda dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus discessūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incompositus, reconditus et, quo Cicero utitur, subabsurdus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:99" default="NO">6, 3, 99</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbabsurdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat absurdly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid subabsurde dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subaccuso: <entryFree id="n45749" type="main" key="su^baccu_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-accūso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accuse somewhat</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus discessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subaccusa quaeso Vestorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 46, 2</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1773" /> <cb n="SUBA" /></sense></entryFree>
subacer: <entryFree id="n45750" type="main" key="suba^ce^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-ăcĕr</orth>, <itype>acris, acre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sharp</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">gustus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subacidus: <entryFree id="n45751" type="main" key="su^ba^ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sourish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 108, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subactio: <entryFree id="n45752" type="main" key="su^bacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subigo</etym>. <sense id="n45752.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a working through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">working up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparing</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">harena fluviatica bacillorum subactionibus in tectorio recipit soliditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subactiones ciborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 107</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45752.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discipline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subacto mihi ingenio opus est ... subactio autem est usus, auditio, lectio, litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subactor: <entryFree id="n45753" type="main" key="su^bactor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a debaucher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polluter</hi> (syn. paedico; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Commod. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subactus: <entryFree id="n45754" type="main" key="su^bactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subigo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45755" type="hapax" key="su^bactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subigo</etym>, <sense id="n45755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a working up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kneading</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subadjuva: <entryFree id="n45756" type="main" key="su^badju^va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-adjŭva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>adjuvo</etym>, <sense id="n45756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assistant</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 6, 27, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subadmiratio: <entryFree id="n45757" type="main" key="su^badmi_ra_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-admīrātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">admiration</hi> (late Lat.), Dion. Exeg. Greg. Nyss. Creat. Hom. 10.</sense></entryFree>
subadmoveo: <entryFree id="n45758" type="main" key="su^badmo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-admŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring close</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:36:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 36, 4</bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
subaduno: <entryFree id="n45759" type="main" key="su^ba^du_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ădūno</orth>, <itype>are, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unite</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 134, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subaemulatio: <entryFree id="n45760" type="main" key="su^baemu^la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-aemŭlātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subaemulor</etym>, <sense id="n45760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secret rivalry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 36, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subaemulor: <entryFree id="n45761" type="main" key="su^baemu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-aemŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n45761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to accumulate secretly</hi>, Ambros. in. Psa. 36, § 10.</sense></entryFree>
subaeratus: <entryFree id="n45762" type="hapax" key="su^baera_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-aerātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has copper underneath</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">inside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:106" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subagitatio: <entryFree id="n45763" type="main" key="su^ba^gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbăgĭtātĭo, sŭbăgĭtātrix, sŭb-ăgĭto</orth>, v. subigitatio, etc.</entryFree>
subagrestis: <entryFree id="n45764" type="main" key="su^ba^grestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăgrestis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather boorish</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">subagreste quiddam planeque subrusticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalaris: <entryFree id="n45765" type="main" key="su^ba_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ālāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is under the arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carried under the arms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culcitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45765.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbālāres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the feathers under the wing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl> Esd. 11, 25.—</sense><sense id="n45765.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbālāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an under-girdle</hi>, Edict. Diocl. p. 25; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subalbens: <entryFree id="n45766" type="hapax" key="su^balbens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-albens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prasinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalbicans: <entryFree id="n45767" type="hapax" key="su^balbi^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-albĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palea rubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalbidus: <entryFree id="n45768" type="main" key="su^balbi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-albĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars corrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 25, 96, § 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 1, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subalbus: <entryFree id="n45769" type="hapax" key="su^balbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-albus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalpinus: <entryFree id="n45770" type="main" key="su^balpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-alpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying near the Alps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sub-Alpine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 34, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subalternicum: <entryFree id="n45771" type="hapax" key="su^balterni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbalternĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of reddish amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subamarus: <entryFree id="n45772" type="main" key="su^ba^ma_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ămārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat bitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitterish</hi> (Ciceronian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 8</bibl>. —Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">subamarum arridens,</quote> <trans><tr>somewhat bitterly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subaperio: <entryFree id="n45773" type="main" key="su^ba^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăpĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to open from within</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nivem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculam sub cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7:section=372" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7, § 372</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subaquaneus: <entryFree id="n45774" type="hapax" key="su^ba^qua_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăquānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aqua</etym>, <sense id="n45774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belongs under water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sub-aqueous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterraneum et subaquaneum viventia carent haustu aëris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subaquilus: <entryFree id="n45775" type="main" key="su^ba^qui^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăquĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tawny</hi> (ante- and postclass.): corpus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 9</bibl>: vultus, Trebell. XXX. Tyr. 30.</sense></entryFree>
subarator: <entryFree id="n45776" type="hapax" key="su^ba^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ărātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who ploughs close to</hi> any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subarescens: <entryFree id="n45777" type="hapax" key="su^ba_rescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ārescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aresco</etym>, <sense id="n45777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growing somewhat dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trullissatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subargutulus: <entryFree id="n45778" type="hapax" key="su^bargu_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-argūtŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat subtle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerably keen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subarmalis: <entryFree id="n45779" type="main" key="su^barma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-armālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>armus</etym>, <sense id="n45779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">passing under the arms</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis (perh. thrown back under the arm),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 426</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbarmāle</orth>, is <gen>n.</gen>, = subarmalis vestis, Valer. ap. Treb. Claud. <cb n="SUBD" /> 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 13</bibl>; cf. subalaris.</sense></entryFree>
subaro: <entryFree id="n45780" type="main" key="su^ba^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ăro</orth>, no <sense id="n45780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to plough close to</hi> any thing (Plinian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subarata ocius senescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 29, 51, § 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subarroganter: <entryFree id="n45781" type="hapax" key="su^barro^ganter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-arrŏganter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n45781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat proudly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arrogantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subasper: <entryFree id="n45782" type="hapax" key="su^basper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-asper</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughish</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">a)lfo/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subassentiens: <entryFree id="n45783" type="hapax" key="su^bassenti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-assentĭens</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>assentio</etym>, <sense id="n45783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">assenting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">yielding a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus subassentientibus umeris movetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subasso: <entryFree id="n45784" type="main" key="su^basso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-asso</orth>, no <sense id="n45784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to roast a little</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:2" default="NO">7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:5" default="NO">7, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 8: squilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subatio: <entryFree id="n45785" type="main" key="su^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subo</etym>, <sense id="n45785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brimming</hi> of swine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Prisc. Serm. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subaudio: <entryFree id="n45786" type="main" key="su^baudi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-audĭo</orth>, <itype>ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (postclass.). <sense id="n45786.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> a word omitted: <cit><quote lang="la">subaudito jubeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 7; 17, 11; Greg. M. in Job, 33, 17.—</sense><sense id="n45786.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hear a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnis subaudiens vocibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subauditio: <entryFree id="n45787" type="main" key="su^baudi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbaudītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subaudio</etym>, <sense id="n45787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplying</hi> a word omitted (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Quaest. Hebr. in Reg. 2, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subauratus: <entryFree id="n45788" type="main" key="su^baura_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-aurātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slightly gilt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32, 3</bibl></cit>: tabellae, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">STATVA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subausculto: <entryFree id="n45789" type="main" key="su^bausculto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ausculto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to listen secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eavesdrop</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subauscultando excipere voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:36:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 36, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprime os: is est, etiam subauscultemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tace, subauscultemus, ecquid de me fiat mentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videntur subauscultare quae loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viris subauscultantibus pariete interposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 20, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subausterus: <entryFree id="n45790" type="main" key="su^bauste_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-austērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather harsh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum austerum vel certe subausterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6</bibl>. 8, § 68.</sense></entryFree>
subbalbe: <entryFree id="n45791" type="hapax" key="subbalbe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-balbē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>balbus</etym>, <sense id="n45791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat stammeringly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canorus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 5, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subballio: <entryFree id="n45792" type="main" key="Subballi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sub-ballĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Under - Ballio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sub - Ballio;</hi> a comically - formed name: <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Tune es Ballio? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Immo vero ego ejus sum Subballio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subbasilicanus: <entryFree id="n45793" type="hapax" key="subba^si^li^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-băsĭlĭcānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>basilica</etym>, <sense id="n45793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lounges around the basilicas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lounger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum odos subbasilicanos omnes abigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
subbibo: <entryFree id="n45794" type="main" key="subbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>bĭbi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tipple</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 58</bibl> (dub.; Speng. si urnas bibit): si paulum subbibisset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subblandior: <entryFree id="n45795" type="main" key="subblandi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-blandĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype> (<sense id="n45795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> subblandibitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 19</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> subblandirier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 22</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to caress</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fondle a little</hi> (ante-class.): subblanditur, palpatur, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 472, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viris alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi inani atque inopi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subbrevis: <entryFree id="n45796" type="hapax" key="subbre^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-brĕvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather short</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium (saliuncae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subbullio: <entryFree id="n45797" type="main" key="subbulli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-bullĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to foam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bubble slightly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subc: <entryFree id="n45798" type="main" key="subc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>, v. succ-.</entryFree>
subdealbo: <entryFree id="n45799" type="hapax" key="subde^albo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dĕalbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to whiten a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make whilish</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 72, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdebilis: <entryFree id="n45800" type="hapax" key="subde_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dēbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat weak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enfeebled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdebilitatus: <entryFree id="n45801" type="hapax" key="subde_bi^li^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dēbĭlĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>debilito</etym>, <sense id="n45801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat enfeebled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">debilitated;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">somewhat discouraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather spiritless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 5, 1</bibl> (dub.; better: subitā re quasi debilitatum, B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
subdefectio: <entryFree id="n45802" type="main" key="subde_fecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdēfectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub - deficio</etym>, <sense id="n45802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight failure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Heptat. 6:30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Heptat. 6, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdeficio: <entryFree id="n45803" type="main" key="subde_fi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dēfĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become more and more feeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fail somewhat</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 343" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 343 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subdeligo: <entryFree id="n45804" type="main" key="subde_li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdēlĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-deligo</etym>, <sense id="n45804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Categ. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Categ. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdescendo: <entryFree id="n45805" type="main" key="subdescendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdescendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sub-descendo</etym>, <sense id="n45805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to descend lower</hi> (late Lat.), Mar. Merc. Commonit. 4, 6.</sense></entryFree>
subdiaconus: <entryFree id="n45806" type="main" key="subdi^a^co^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dĭăcŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sub - deacon</hi>, <cb n="SUBD" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 53" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:63" default="NO">63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 12, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdialis: <entryFree id="n45807" type="main" key="subdi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dĭālis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">subdīvālis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 11, 4</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dius</etym>, <sense id="n45807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is in the open air</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">inambulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 12, 29, § 117</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subdĭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">open galleries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terraces;</hi> a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(pai/qria, u(/paiqra</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 186</bibl>.—Also in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdival domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdifficilis: <entryFree id="n45808" type="hapax" key="subdiffi^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-diffĭcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat difficult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdiffido: <entryFree id="n45809" type="hapax" key="subdiffi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-diffīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be somewhat distrustful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdimidius: <entryFree id="n45810" type="hapax" key="subdi_mi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dīmĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, of a number, <sense id="n45810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half as much less</hi>, <hi rend="ital">less by one half of itself</hi> (i. e. that bears to another the ratio of 2 to 3): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus (opp. superdimidius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdisjunctio: <entryFree id="n45811" type="main" key="subdisjuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-disjunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, gram. t. t., <sense id="n45811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a minor stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 432</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
subdisjunctivus: <entryFree id="n45812" type="main" key="subdisjuncti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-disjunctīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subdisjunctive;</hi> said of two statements opposed to each other in such a way that neither of them may hold good (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec verba: ille aut ille, non solum disjunctiva sed etiam subdisjunctivae orationis sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:124" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1029</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
subdistinguo: <entryFree id="n45813" type="main" key="subdistinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-distinguo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a smaller interpunction</hi> (perh. <hi rend="ital">a colon</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subditicius: <entryFree id="n45814" type="main" key="subdi^ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdĭtīcĭus</orth> (later <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subdo</etym>, <sense id="n45814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">substituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposititious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi> (perh. only ante- and postclass., since the correct read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 69</bibl>, is subditivum; and in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>, subditos): <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subditivus: <entryFree id="n45815" type="main" key="subdi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">substituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposititious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de illo subditivo Sosia mirum nimis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">archipirata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem ut subditivum arguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Subdĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy of Cœcilius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 1</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 39 sq. Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
subdito: <entryFree id="n45816" type="spur" key="subdi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 604</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.</entryFree>
subditus: <entryFree id="n45817" type="main" key="subdi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from subdo.</entryFree>
subdiu: <entryFree id="n45818" type="main" key="subdiu_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-diū</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n45818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdival: <entryFree id="n45819" type="main" key="subdi_val"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdīval</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, v. subdialis.</entryFree>
subdivalis: <entryFree id="n45820" type="main" key="subdi_va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdīvālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. subdialis.</entryFree>
subdivido: <entryFree id="n45821" type="main" key="subdi_vi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dīvĭdo</orth>, <itype>īsi, īsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to subdivide</hi> (late Lat.): libros, Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde subdivisimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3</bibl></cit> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">hebdomades,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subdivisio: <entryFree id="n45822" type="main" key="subdi_vi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdīvīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subdivido</etym>, <sense id="n45822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subdivision</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 28, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 58, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
subdivisus: <entryFree id="n45823" type="main" key="subdi_vi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdīvīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subdivido.</entryFree>
subdo: <entryFree id="n45824" type="main" key="subdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-do</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n45824.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay under</hi> (syn.: suppono, sterno). </sense><sense id="n45824.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n45824.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: ego puerum interead ancillae subdam lactantem meae, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 153, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 26 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignem subdito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 105, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem magnetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1046" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1046</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum oculo uni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 447</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem oculorum visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcas vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugionem pulvino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcaria equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">risus stimulos animo subdidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id genus animalium (tauros) aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se aquis,</quote> <trans><tr>to plunge under</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla vinclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:90" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>to append</tr>, <tr>add</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:11:3" default="NO">19, 11, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tu paulisper haesisti, deinde ilico subdidisti: quid de duobus consulibus, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>subjoined</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 23</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of places, in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: Celaletae (populi) majores Haemo, Minores Rhodopae subditi, <hi rend="ital">that dwell at the foot of Mount Hœmus</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Libye subdita Cancro,</quote> <trans><tr>lying under</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:194" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45824.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to bring under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, = subicere (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Plutonis subdita regno Magna deum proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot subdite rebus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:124" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdidit Oceanum sceptris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 42</bibl></cit>: Hispanum Oceanum legibus, id. <pb n="1774" /> <cb n="SUBD" /> III. Cons. Stil. praef. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">rem tam magnam iisdem tempestatibus, iisdem casibus subdere,</quote> <trans><tr>to expose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 40</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subdĭ-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">subditas viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Tit. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jud. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justum est, subditum esse Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subditi estote in omni timore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 18.—</sense><sense id="n45824.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply; to yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford</hi> (so not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">iraï fax subdita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id nobis acriores ad studia dicendi faces subdidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritatis militum animis subdere ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio stimulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45824.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To put in the place of</hi> another person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n45824.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: te rogo, in Hirtii locum me subdas, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos in eorum locum subditos domi suae reservavit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem in meum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:32:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 32, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 25, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immutavit et subdidit verbum ei verbo, quod omiserat, finitimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45824.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to put something spurious in the place of</hi> another person or thing; <hi rend="ital">to substitute falsely; to forge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make up</hi> (not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. substituo): subditum se suspicatur,</quote> <trans><tr>that he is a spurious child</tr>, <tr>a changeling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me subditum et pellice genitum appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:10:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 10, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos tamquam subditos summovere familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. subditicios): <cit><quote lang="la">abolendo rumori Nero subdidit reos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subditis, qui accusatorum nomina sustinerent,</quote> <trans><tr>suborned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina majestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 36</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
subdoceo: <entryFree id="n45825" type="main" key="subdo^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to teach as an assistant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act as an assistant-teacher</hi> for a person (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdocere grammatico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdoctor: <entryFree id="n45826" type="hapax" key="subdoctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-doctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an underteacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant-instructor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdole: <entryFree id="n45827" type="main" key="subdo^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdŏlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subdolus <sense id="n45827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subdolens: <entryFree id="n45828" type="main" key="subdo^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub - doleo</etym>, <sense id="n45828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat painful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucium sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdolositas: <entryFree id="n45829" type="main" key="subdo^lo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdŏlōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub - dolosus</etym>, <sense id="n45829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">craft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 10</bibl>, n. 229.</sense></entryFree>
subdolosus: <entryFree id="n45830" type="main" key="subdo^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subdŏlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crafty</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 106, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdolus: <entryFree id="n45831" type="main" key="subdo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat crafty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi> (mostly ante - class. and post - Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fallax, astutus): homo et sycophanta et subdolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut viro subdola sies, memento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdola adversus senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugurtha, cognitā vanitate legati, subdolus ejus augere amentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultus ac subdolus fingendis virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 51</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">animus audax, subdolus, varius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdolus ac versutus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:102:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 102, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: oratio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 20</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pellacia ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 560</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1003" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1003</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea loci forma incertis vadis subdola et nobis adversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendit rete subdolum turdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subdŏlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat craftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunningly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">deceitfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdole blanditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil subdole, nihil versute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subdomo: <entryFree id="n45832" type="hapax" key="subdo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dŏmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to subject by taming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdubito: <entryFree id="n45833" type="main" key="subdu^bi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dŭbĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a little doubtful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">undecided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have some hesitation</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">antea subdubitabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significabant tuae litterae, te subdubitare, quā essem erga illum voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subduco: <entryFree id="n45834" type="main" key="subdu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n45834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. subduxti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 25</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> subduxe, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to draw from under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from below.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45834.1" n="I" level="1"> Without the idea of removal. </sense><sense id="n45834.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pull up; to lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam ad nasum admoveto: ita subducito susum animam, quam plurimum poteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cataractam funibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 28, 10</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SUBD" /> subductis (tunicis) usque ad inguen, <hi rend="ital">pulled up</hi> (opp. demissis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 26</bibl>: supercilia, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 399, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 399:33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 399, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 48, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1:6 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 1, 1, 6 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subducto voltu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> (3, 1), 9.—</sense><sense id="n45834.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haul up</hi> on land (a ship out of the water; <cit><quote lang="la">class. and freq.): navim in pulvinarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longas naves in aridum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis subducta in terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves regiae in campo Martio subductae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab classe, quae Corcyrae subducta erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis, quae subducta esset ad Gytheum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:27" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 2 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45834.4" n="II" level="1"> With the idea of removal implied, <hi rend="ital">to draw away from among; to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off; to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, etc. (class.; syn. subtraho). </sense><sense id="n45834.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi bullabit vinum, ignem subducito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 105, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides ex turri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux fidum capiti subduxerat ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subduc cibum unum diem athletae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sucus pecori et lac subducitur agnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae Turnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 615</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem manibus Graium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praesenti periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:72:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 72, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se pedibus (terra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab ipso Vulnere (fera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 781</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n45834.6" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n45834.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To purge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evacuate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam is cibus subduceret sensim alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45834.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Vela celeriter, <hi rend="ital">to take in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furl</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 45, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">rem de judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45834.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw off</hi> forces from one position to another (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes aliquot subductas ex dextro cornu post aciem circumducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidas ex mediā acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triarios ex postremā acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subductis ordinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his centuriones omnes lectos et evocatos ... in primam aciem subducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in proximum collem subducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites pleno gradu in collem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen in aequiorem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45834.10" n="C" level="2"> With the idea of stealth or secrecy. </sense><sense id="n45834.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take away secretly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by stealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>: Atreus quam (pecudem auream) sibi Thyestem subduxe queritur, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui anulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subducta viatica plorat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post ignem aethereā domo Subductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi rivalis subducit certos amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:45" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccularii partem subducunt, partem subtrahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides furto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum subductum omnibus ventis,</quote> <trans><tr>secured against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45834.12" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">me</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to take one's self away by stealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steal away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus est subducere hinc me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam te subduxti mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de circulo se subduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo se subducere ab ipso Vulnere visa fera est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 781</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se clam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 93, 1: at nos quaerimus illa (verba), tamquam lateant semper seseque subducant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 21.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve terra se pedibus subducat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā se subducere colles Incipiunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to slope down gradually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: fons subducitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>loses itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45834.13" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45834.14" n="1" level="3"> Rationem, <hi rend="ital">to draw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">balance</hi> an account (by subtracting one set of items from another; class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.): subduxi ratiunculam, Quantum aeris mihi sit, quantumque alieni siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intus subducam ratiunculam, quantillum argenti mi siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subducamus summam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">assidunt, subducunt: ad numum convenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45834.15" n="2" level="3"> In gen.: rationem, <hi rend="ital">to deliberate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationibus subductis summam feci cogitationum mearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medea et Atreus ... initā subductāque ratione nefaria scelera meditantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: ineundis subducendisque rationibus, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 399, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, calculis subductis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene subductā ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quid intersit, si tuos digitos novi, certe habes subductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 31</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">subductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n45834.16" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. A.) <hi rend="ital">Raised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upturned</hi>: <cb n="SUBE" /> quod vituperones suos subducti supercilii carptores appellavit (Laevius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45834.17" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Withdrawn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, = remotus (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">terra subductior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 591</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subductarius: <entryFree id="n45835" type="main" key="subducta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subductārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subduco, I.</etym>, <sense id="n45835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for drawing up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <trans><tr>hoisting-ropes</tr>, <tr>lifts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">135, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subductio: <entryFree id="n45836" type="main" key="subducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45836.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to subduco, I. B. 1.) Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a hauling ashore</hi> of a ship: ad celeritatem onerandi subductionesque paulo facit humiliores (naves), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45836.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to subduco, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">A reckoning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:30:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 30, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subductus: <entryFree id="n45837" type="main" key="subductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-ductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. subduco.</entryFree>
subdulcis: <entryFree id="n45838" type="main" key="subdulcis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dulcis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sweet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweetish</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 37, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:98" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 10, 63, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subdurus: <entryFree id="n45839" type="main" key="subdu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-dūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardish.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n45839.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(genus verrucae) subdurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45839.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 12:46" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 12, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subedo: <entryFree id="n45840" type="main" key="su^be^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ēdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wear away below</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e scopulo, quem rauca subederat unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 783</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jer. 1, 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subelectio: <entryFree id="n45841" type="main" key="su^be_lecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbēlectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-eligo</etym>, <sense id="n45841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a further selection</hi> (late Lat.): subelectio est quando de bonis electis eliguntur meliores, Ps.<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Frater. Erem. Serm. 39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Frater. Erem. Serm. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subeligo: <entryFree id="n45842" type="main" key="su^be_li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbēlĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choose further</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fratr. Serm. 39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fratr. Serm. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subenarro: <entryFree id="n45843" type="main" key="su^be_narro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ēnarro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n45843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to relate</hi> (late Lat.), Anon. [Hilar.] in Job, 2, p. 174.</sense></entryFree>
subeo: <entryFree id="n45844" type="main" key="su^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, ĭtum, īre</itype> (<sense id="n45844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> subīvit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:314" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:155" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 155</bibl>: subivimus, Claud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl> dub.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go under</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceed to</hi> a place; <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go on; to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed; to go down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink; to come up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring up</hi> (cf. succedo). </sense><sense id="n45844.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45844.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45844.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">subire sub falas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nemoris latebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 601</bibl></cit>; cf.: in aliquem locum, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 74, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">in adversum Romani subiere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adversos montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudine factā subeunt,</quote> <trans><tr>advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albani subiere ad montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subire ad portam castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 16, 2</bibl></cit>;
