Bruti statuae: utinam viveres, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quaeret Pater Urbium Subscribi statuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">meo subscribi causa sepulcro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 563</bibl></cit>: quarum (litterarum) exemplum subscripsi, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13</bibl>, A, § 1; Treb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seminaria ulmorum parentur eā ratione, quam deinceps subscripsimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46026.3" n="1" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to write down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">subscribe one's name</hi> to an accusation (either as principal prosecutor or as seconding others), together with the ground of the charge; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecute</hi>: in L. Popillium subscripsit L. Gellius, quod <cb n="SUBS" /> is pecuniam accepisset, quo innocentem condemnaret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 47, 131</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia parricidii causa subscripta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 19, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinium de ambitu reum fecit P. Sulla, subscribente privigno Memmio, fratre Caecilio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Capito Agrippae subscripsit in C. Cassium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">accusanti patrono subscripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras subscribam homini dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:92" default="NO">47, 2, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.4" n="2" level="3"> Publicists' t. t., of the censor, <hi rend="ital">to write down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note down</hi> the reason of his official censure under or against the name of the person censured: <cit><quote lang="la">video animadvertisse censores in judices quosdam illius consilii Juniani, cum istam ipsam causam subscriberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 42, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censor C. Ateium notavit, quod ementitum auspicia subscripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quae de judicio corrupto subscripserint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 45, 127</bibl></cit>: ac primum illud statuamus, utrum quia censores subscripserint, ita sit; <cit><quote lang="la">an quia ita fuerit, illi subscripserint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod censores de ceteris subscripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subscribe</hi> a document (by appending one's name or a formula of greeting; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): omnes (tutores) debent unius editioni subscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationibus, testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:40" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, also, rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:80" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 1, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:12" default="NO">34, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si subscripserit in tabulis emptionis, concessisse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:6:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 6, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de supplicio cujusdam capite damnati, ut ex more subscriberet, admoneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Commodus in subscribendo tardus et neglegens, ita ut libellis una forma multis subscriberet, in epistolis autem plurimis Vale tantum scriberet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl> Wolf (cf. Dio, 57, 11).—</sense><sense id="n46026.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46026.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To assent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approve of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam prius pro potestate subscripsit, quam quingenties sestertium ad peragendam Auream domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut gratiae aut odio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiis accusationibusque Hannibalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fortuna voto subscripserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: tuo desiderio, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 95</bibl> (96): <cit><quote lang="la">amoribus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accord</hi> a thing to any one (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idol. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46026.9" n="II" level="1"> (With the idea of the verb predom.) <hi rend="ital">To write</hi> or <hi rend="ital">note down</hi> (=notare; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): numerum aratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:51:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiria nostra (a delatoribus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit> (acc. to others this passage belongs to B. 1.).</sense></entryFree>
subscriptio: <entryFree id="n46027" type="main" key="subscripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subscribo</etym>. <sense id="n46027.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing written underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a subscription</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n46027.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Serapionis subscriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46027.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46027.3" n="1" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a subscription</hi> to an accusation: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui crimen obiciatur, praecedere debet in crimen subscriptio, quae res ad id inventa est, ne facile quis prosiliat ad accusationem, cum sciat inultam sibi non futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consecratur subscriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 22:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Mort. Claud. 14:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lud. Mort. Claud. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 14:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 15:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—Also of a <hi rend="ital">joint subscription</hi>, by one who seconds the accusation (cf. subscribo, I. B. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">subscriptionem sibi postularunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46027.4" n="2" level="3"> Publicists' t. t., of the censor, <hi rend="ital">a noting down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note</hi> of the offence censured: <cit><quote lang="la">subscriptio censoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42, 118</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46027.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A signature</hi> of a document (consisting of the subscription of one's name or the appending of a formula of greeting; <cit><quote lang="la">v. subscribo, I. B. 3.): si testator specialiter subscriptione suā declaraverit, dictasse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque imperator per epistolam et subscriptionem statuit, legem esse constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Rhodiorum magistratus, quod litteras publicas sine subscriptione ad se dederant, evocasset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl></cit> Wolf (cf. Dio, 57, 11).—</sense><sense id="n46027.6" n="4" level="3"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">a warrant</hi> of the emperor (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 9</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n46027.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugerum subscriptio ac professio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 3, 47, § 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subscriptor: <entryFree id="n46028" type="main" key="subscriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subscriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n46028.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to subscribo, I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">A signer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joint-signer</hi> <pb n="1781" /> <cb n="SUBS" /> of an accusation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venalis scriptor et subscriptor tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:19:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatore Lentulo subscriptoribusque ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: sine ullo subscriptore descendit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46028.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to subscribo, I. B. 3. b.) <hi rend="ital">One who subscribes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assents to</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a favorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approver</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae legisque fundus subscriptorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscriptores approbatoresque verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subscriptus: <entryFree id="n46029" type="main" key="subscriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subscribo.</entryFree>
subscruposus: <entryFree id="n46030" type="main" key="subscru_po_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-scrūpōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (late Lat.), <sense id="n46030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">critical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">examinator meritorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subscus: <entryFree id="n46031" type="main" key="subscu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subscūs</orth>, <itype>ūdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-cudo</etym>, <sense id="n46031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tongue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tenon of a dovetail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscudes appellantur cuneatae tabellae, quibus tabulae inter se configuntur, quia, quo eae immittuntur, succuditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl></cit> Müll.: nec ulla subscus cohibet compagem alvei, Pac. ap. Fest. l. l. (Trag. Rel. v. 250 Rib.): terebratus multum sit et subscudes additae, Plaut. ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscudibus et catenis uncis retentari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—Collat. form of <number>plur.</number> subscudines, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 27.</sense></entryFree>
subsecivus: <entryFree id="n46032" type="main" key="subse^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕcīvus</orth>, v. subsicivus.</entryFree>
subseco: <entryFree id="n46033" type="main" key="subse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cui, ctum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut away below; to clip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pare</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): stramentum et manipulum falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: herbam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:49:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 49, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:23:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes, unde creatus erat (Saturnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:276" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:230" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papavereas ungue comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:438" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 438</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsectus: <entryFree id="n46034" type="main" key="subsectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subseco.</entryFree>
subsecundarius: <entryFree id="n46035" type="hapax" key="subse^cunda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĕcundārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that comes afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">additional</hi>: tempora, <hi rend="ital">spare time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leisure moments</hi> (with subseciva), Gell. N. A. praef. § 23.</sense></entryFree>
subsellium: <entryFree id="n46036" type="main" key="subselli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsellĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sub-sella</etym>, <sense id="n46036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a low bench</hi> (quod non plane erat sella, subsellium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=128" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 128</bibl> Müll.); hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a bench</hi> for sitting upon, <hi rend="ital">a seat</hi> of any kind (in a house, the theatre, the curia, a court, etc.; syn.: scamnum, sedile). </sense><sense id="n46036.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ter. 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 1</bibl>.—Of places in the theatre: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conquisitores singuli in subsellia Eant per totam caveam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 5</bibl>; Cic. Corn. Fragm. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> (ap. Orell. V. 2, p. 68); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 41 al.</bibl>—Of the seats of senators in the curia: <cit><quote lang="la">volo, hoc oratori contingat, ... ut locus in subselliis occupetur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23 al.</bibl>—In the courts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 14, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere in accusatorum subselliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advocato adversis subselliis sedenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:132" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:2" default="NO">12, 3, 2</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir imi subselli,</quote> <trans><tr>a man of no account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46036.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46036.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a judge's seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusabat tribunus plebis idem in contionibus, idem ad subsellia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ab subselliis in rostra detulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46036.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46036.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The bench</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the occupants of a bench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibis quantum subsellia quinque solus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:27:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 27, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46036.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribunal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">age vero ne semper forum, subsellia, rostra, curiamque meditere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia grandiorem et pleniorem vocem desiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 84, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longi subsellii judicatio et mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui habitaret in subselliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 264</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versatus in utrisque subselliis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as judge and advocate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsentator: <entryFree id="n46037" type="hapax" key="subsenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sub-sentio, formed after the analogy of assentator</etym>, <sense id="n46037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flatterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fawner</hi>: subdoli, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:13, p. 62" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 13, p. 62</bibl> Nieb.</sense></entryFree>
subsentio: <entryFree id="n46038" type="hapax" key="subsenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sentĭo</orth>, <itype>si, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to notice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perceive secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smell out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi subsensi id quoque, Illos ibi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsequenter: <entryFree id="n46039" type="main" key="subse^quenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subsequor <sense id="n46039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subsequium: <entryFree id="n46040" type="main" key="subse^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕquĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sub-sequor</etym>, <sense id="n46040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sequel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what follows after</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsequor: <entryFree id="n46041" type="main" key="subse^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĕquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow close after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immediately; to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensue</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n46041.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46041.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <cb n="SUBS" /> <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequor te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">has (cohortes) subsidiariae ternae subsequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:528" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 528</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46041.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom verba facis, subsequere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar equitatu praemisso sequebatur omnibus copiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl>; 5, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequitur, pressoque legit vestigia gressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequiturque manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:336" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 336</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46041.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. or abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hesperus) tum antecedens, tum subsequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minorem Septentrionem Cepheus a tergo subsequitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis subsequens verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hos motus subsequi debet gestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem subsecuti libri Tusculanarum disputationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 496</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ducis consilia favor subsecutus militum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequenti tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">subsequenti anno,</quote> <trans><tr>the following</tr>, <tr>next year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima subsequitur, quid agas, audire voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46041.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to follow after</hi>, mentally or in opinion, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comply with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conform to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitate</hi> a person or thing; with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Speusippus Platonem avunculum subsequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut locupletes omnes summum ordinem subsequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te imitari. te subsequi student,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 84, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirifice ipse suo sermone subsecutus est humanitatem litterarum tuarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orationis) vim ac varietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 7, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕquenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one after another</hi>, Mess. Corv. Prog. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 87" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsequus: <entryFree id="n46042" type="main" key="subse^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕquus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subsequor</etym>, <sense id="n46042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeeding</hi> (late Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">form subsequus: probatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">form subsicuus: metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subsericus: <entryFree id="n46043" type="main" key="subse_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-silken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 26</bibl></cit>; Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsero: <entryFree id="n46044" type="main" key="subse^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant after</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46044.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to plant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distribute secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrimenta fictis criminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46045" type="main" key="subse^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n46045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sertum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insert under</hi> (late Lat.). * </sense><sense id="n46045.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsertis manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 200, 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46045.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res monuit super Eutherio pauca subserere,</quote> <trans><tr>to add</tr>, <tr>subjoin</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 11, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsertus: <entryFree id="n46046" type="main" key="subsertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 2. subsero.</entryFree>
subservio: <entryFree id="n46047" type="main" key="subservi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-servĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be subject to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n46047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec, quae viros subservire Sibi postulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 2:13, p. 62" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 2, 13, p. 62</bibl> Nieb. (Com. Rel. p. 22 Rib.).—* </sense><sense id="n46047.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to comply with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accommodate one's self to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsessa: <entryFree id="n46048" type="main" key="subsessa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subsido</etym>, <sense id="n46048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ambush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambuscade</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subsessas occultius collocare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in subsessā esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium dolos subsessas vocamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 268</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsessor: <entryFree id="n46049" type="main" key="subsessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a waylayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lier-in-wait</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46049.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsessores vocantur, qui occisuri aliquem delitescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 268</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 498</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsessores cum venabulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46049.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieni matrimonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO">7, 2</bibl>, ext. 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subsessoris et adulteri persona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsicivus: <entryFree id="n46050" type="main" key="subsi^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭcīvus</orth>, less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĕcī-vus</orth> (also transp. <orth extent="full" lang="la">subcĭsīvus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cĭsīvus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> [sub-seco). <sense id="n46050.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, as t. t. of the agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">that is cut off and left remaining</hi>, in surveying lands.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭcīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a remainder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">small patch of land</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">subsiciva, quae divisis per veteranos agris carptim superfuerunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Auct. Rei Agr. ap. Goes. p. 17; 23; <cit><quote lang="la">39: mensores nonnumquam dicunt in subsicivum esse unciam agri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46050.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">that remains over and above</hi> the principal occupation, etc.; <hi rend="ital">over-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extra</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subsiciva quaedam tempora incurrunt, quae ego perire non patior,</quote> <trans><tr>spare time</tr>, <tr>leisure hours</tr>, <tr>odd hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. Plin. H. N. praef. § 18 Sillig: <cb n="SUBS" /> aliquid subsicivi temporis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora (with subsecundaria), Gell. N. A. praef. § 23: tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec temporum velut subsiciva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46050.2" n="B" level="2"> Of that which is done in extra time, etc., <hi rend="ital">accessory work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over-work</hi>: opera, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 175, 22</bibl>; so in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsicivis operis, ut aiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:89:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 89, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(philosophia) non est res subsiciva, ordinaria est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a thing to be attended to at odd times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46050.3" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">remaining over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasional</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incidental</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">una tantum subsiciva solicitudo nobis relicta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 132, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>, p. 212, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (Italiam) subsicivam Graeciam fecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 294, 23</bibl></cit>: succisiva proles, Lact. Opif. Dei, 12, 15 Bünem.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivacitas illic aeterna est, hic caduca et subsiciva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 4, p. 44, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsicuus: <entryFree id="n46051" type="main" key="subsi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. subsequus.</entryFree>
subsidentia: <entryFree id="n46052" type="hapax" key="subsi_denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsīdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subsido</etym>, <sense id="n46052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sinking down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsidence;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a settling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sediment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subsideo: <entryFree id="n46053" type="main" key="subsi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. subsido.</entryFree>
subsidialis: <entryFree id="n46054" type="main" key="subsi^di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subsidium</etym>, <sense id="n46054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a reserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsidiary</hi> (late Lat. for the class. subsidiarius): <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsidiarius: <entryFree id="n46055" type="main" key="subsi^di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>; in milit. lang., <sense id="n46055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a reserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsidiary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46055.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46055.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl>: acies, Auct. B. Afr. 59, 2: naves, Auct. B. Alex. 14, 3.—</sense><sense id="n46055.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭdĭ-ārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the reserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">body of reserve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46055.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., out of the military sphere, <hi rend="ital">serving for support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsidiary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes, = resex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 13</bibl></cit> and 16.—</sense><sense id="n46055.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">actio, jurid. t. t.,</quote> <trans><tr>a form of action by which the ward seeks compensation from the magistrate who has given him an improper guardian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 8, 1</bibl></cit> pr.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 75, 1</bibl> and 5.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, adverb.: subsidiaria agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to institute such an action</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:8:1:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 8, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsidior: <entryFree id="n46056" type="hapax" key="subsi^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭdĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n46056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to act as a reserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand in reserve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:13:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsidium: <entryFree id="n46057" type="main" key="subsi^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>subsideo</etym>. <sense id="n46057.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46057.1" n="A" level="2"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">the troops stationed in reserve</hi> in the third line of battle (behind the principes), <hi rend="ital">the line of reserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve-ranks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triarii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidium dicebatur, quando milites subsidebant in extremā acie labentique aciei succurrebant. Quod genus militum constabat ex iis, qui emeruerant stipendia, locum tamen retinebant in exercitu: quae erat tertia acies triariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidium, quod postpositum est ad subveniendum laborantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 223</bibl></cit> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">triarii quoque dicti, quod in acie tertio ordine extremis subsidio deponebantur: quod hi subsidebant, ab eo subsidium dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 89</bibl></cit> ib. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">subsidia et secundam aciem adortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculatores fugerunt inter subsidia ad secundam aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsa frons prima et trepidatio subsidiis illata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in subsidiis pugnacissimas locaverunt gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in subsidiis positi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46057.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A body of reserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an auxiliary corps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary forces</hi>, etc. (class.; syn.: suppetiae, auxilium): duae cohortes de subsidio procedunt, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 363, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem esse in angusto vidit, neque ullum esse subsidium, quod submitti posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque certa subsidia collocari poterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes veteranas in fronte, post eas ceterum exercitum in subsidiis locat,</quote> <trans><tr>stationed as a reserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46057.3" n="C" level="2"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">support</hi> in battle, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alius alii subsidium ferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditores Baleares subsidio oppidanis mittit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missi in subsidium equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiae subsidio proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">integros subsidio adducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidio venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commune in Germanos Gallosque subsidium, octo legiones erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46057.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, etc. (syn. adjumentum). </sense><sense id="n46057.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi quaerere, ubi jurando tuo satis sit subsidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi hoc subsidium (sc. juris interpretationem) jam inde ab adulescentia comparavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45</bibl></cit> 199; cf.: ut illud subsidium (sc. bibliothe <pb n="1782" /> <cb n="SUBS" /> cam) senectuti parem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 3, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidium bellissimum existimo senectuti otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine talium virorum subsidio resistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his difficultatibus duae res erant subsidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidissimum annonae subsidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum ad subsidium fortunae relictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliud subsidium quam misericordia Caesaris fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi subsidio sit praesens numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:285" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 285</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46057.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">industriae subsidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentaria subsidia rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi subsidia ad omnes vitae status parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his ego subsidiis ea sum consecutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes casus subsidia comparare,</quote> <trans><tr>to prepare resources</tr>, <tr>make provision</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare circa Capreas importuosum et vix modicis navigiis pauca subsidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsido: <entryFree id="n46058" type="main" key="subsi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sīdo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, sessum, 3</itype> (collat. form acc. to 2d conj., subsīdent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 646</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 22</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46058.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sit down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crouch down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squat; to set one's self down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n46058.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46058.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: agite nunc, subsidite omnes, quasi solent triarii, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 89</bibl> Müll.; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl> ib.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidunt Hispani adversus emissa tela ab hoste, inde ad mittenda ipsi consurgunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem militum subsidere in subsidiis jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">poplite subsidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii elephanti clunibus subsidentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsedit in illā Ante fores ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 297</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46058.4" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidebant campi, crescebant montibus altis Ascensus: neque enim poterant subsidere saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limus mundi ut faex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 497</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">faeces in fundis vasorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urinā quod subsidit, si album est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 19, § 68</bibl></cit>: aqua subsidit, <hi rend="ital">settles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becomes clear</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 5: flumina, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subside</hi> (opp. surgit humus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 344</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans><tr>subside</tr>, <tr>abate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 820</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, transf., venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit> (15); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:151" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 151</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremus galeāque imā subsidit Acestes,</quote> <trans><tr>remains at the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur posito rigore Subsidit digitis ceditque,</quote> <trans><tr>gives way</tr>, <tr>yields</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae per mare pessum Subsedere suis pariter cum civibus urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>are sunk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terraene dehiscent Subsidentque urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 646</bibl></cit>: subsidere fata videbat, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, like the heavier weight on the scales, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:28" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46058.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46058.6" n="a" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to settle down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish one's self</hi> in a place; <hi rend="ital">to remain sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (apes) ex alvo minus frequentes evadunt ac subsidit pars aliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsedi in ipsā viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: multitudo ... quae in castris subsederat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam ex Vitelliis subsedisse Nuceriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oppido Reatino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commixti corpore tantum Subsident Teucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 836</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46058.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">in Nilo navicula subsedit,</quote> <trans><tr>ran aground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46058.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To crouch down on the watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie in wait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie in ambush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur neque ante occurrit, ne ille in villā resideret: nec eo in loco subsedit, quo ille noctu venturus esset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illum ad urbem noctu accessurum sciebat, subsidendum atque exspectandum fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem militum subsidere in insidiis jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 7</bibl></cit>; v. II. infra.—</sense><sense id="n46058.9" n="c" level="4"> Of female animals, <hi rend="ital">to yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi> the male (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">maribus subsidere (pecudes et equae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvet ut tigres subsidere cervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46058.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to subside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decrease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in controversiis subsidit impetus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec silentio subsidat, sed firmetur consuetudine (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia subsidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:69" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidata subsidunt et sperata decipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 13:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46058.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To settle down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc accidit ut aetas jam altioribus disciplinis debita in scholā minore subsidat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is held back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46058.12" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (acc. to I. A. 2. b.), <hi rend="ital">to lie in wait for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to waylay</hi> any one (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">devictam Asiam (i. e. Agamemnonem) subsedit adulter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:221" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiosos homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insontem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens foramen,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SUBS" /> regnum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 226</bibl> Heyne and Mart. (dub. Lag. regno).</sense></entryFree>
subsiduus: <entryFree id="n46059" type="hapax" key="subsi^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subsideo</etym>, <sense id="n46059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sinking down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 474</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsignanus: <entryFree id="n46060" type="main" key="subsigna_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsignānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-signum</etym>, <sense id="n46060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serves under the standard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of legionary soldiers kept in reserve to strengthen the centre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsignatio: <entryFree id="n46061" type="main" key="subsigna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsignātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subsigno</etym>, <sense id="n46061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subscription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signature.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n46061.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres subsignationis verbo pro subscriptione uti solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 39</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46061.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a firm promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assurance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenitentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subsigno: <entryFree id="n46062" type="main" key="subsigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-signo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">write beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to undersign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subscribe</hi> (mostly post - Aug.; syn. subscribo). </sense><sense id="n46062.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditas notas subsignabimus Catonis maxime verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronis sententiam ipsius verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 25, 61, § 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsignatum dicitur quod ab aliquo subscriptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc subsignare dicimus pro subscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=281" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 281</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n46062.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n46062.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi> on a list: <cit><quote lang="la">subsignari apud aerarium (praedia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 32, 80</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46062.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pledge</hi> by signing: <cit><quote lang="la">PRAEDIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207, 1</bibl></cit> and 3: <cit><quote lang="la">res pro cautelā litis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 37, 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultates eorum, quae subsignatae sunt fisco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46062.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pledge; to engage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id jam nunc apud te subsigno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsilio: <entryFree id="n46063" type="main" key="subsi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>salio</etym>, <sense id="n46063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spring upwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leap up</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n46063.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">decido de lecto praeceps, subsilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 64</bibl>: non subsilis ac plaudis? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 135, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper damnosi subsiluere canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 46: <cit><quote lang="la">Pegasus adusque caelum subsilit ac resultat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsiliunt ignes ad tecta domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 191</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46063.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsiluisti et acrior constitisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46063.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To leap into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum flammis dexteram objecimus aut voluntariam subsiluimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsilles: <entryFree id="n46064" type="gloss" key="subsilles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsilles</orth> <itype>dicebantur quaedam lamellae sacrificiis necessariae</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=307" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 307</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl> ib.</entryFree>
subsimilis: <entryFree id="n46065" type="main" key="subsi^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partly similar</hi> (very rare): <foreign lang="greek">*meli/khra</foreign> melli albo subsimilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsimile aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subsimus: <entryFree id="n46066" type="hapax" key="subsi_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a nose slightly turned up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat snub-nosed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pug-nosed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsipere: <entryFree id="n46067" type="gloss" key="subsi^pe^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsĭpĕre</orth> <itype>quod non plane sapit</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=128" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 128</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
subsistentia: <entryFree id="n46068" type="main" key="subsistentia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsistentia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subsisto</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(po)stasis</foreign>, <sense id="n46068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reality</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; Boëth. Duab. Nat. p. 950.</sense></entryFree>
subsisto: <entryFree id="n46069" type="main" key="subsisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46069.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take a stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain standing; to stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46069.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46069.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui in itinere substiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis campestribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eodem loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:16" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 16</bibl></cit>: ad insulam Tauridem, Auct. B. Alex. 45, 1: circa ima (opp. ad summa niti), Quint. prooem. § 20.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo proelio sublati Helvetii audacius subsistere ... coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substitit Aeneas et se collegit in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 491</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 622</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">115, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquo flexu viae ... occultus subsistebat,</quote> <trans><tr>stationed himself in ambush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">occultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.4" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">substitit unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros salsus in alarum sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 47, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsistit radius cubiti,</quote> <trans><tr>remains in its place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substitit auspicii lingua timore mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46069.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi> in a place: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ubi nationum subsisterent legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=155" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 155</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">erimus ibi die dedicationis: subsistemus fortasse et sequenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra tecta (opp. in aperto vagari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eā die domi subsisteret, orabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:57:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 57, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.7" n="b" level="4"> Esp. (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to remain alive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:30:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 4, 30, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 32, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To make a stand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to stand firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out; to withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi suffulcis firmiter, Non potes subsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: Hannibali<cb n="SUBS" />  atque ejus armis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeo juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 806</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque ancorae funesque subsisterent, neque, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>stood</tr>, <tr>held out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46069.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46069.11" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause;
