to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsistere (in dicendo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsistit omnis sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius ibunt qui ad summa nitentur, quam qui circa ima substiterint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. 20: <cit><quote lang="la">intra priorem paupertatem subsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 53</bibl></cit>: equitum nomen subsistebat in turmis equorum publicorum, <hi rend="ital">still remains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subsists only in</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 7, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum quoque et filium familias procuratorem posse habere aiunt: et quantum ad filium familias, verum est: in servo subsistimus,</quote> <trans><tr>we pause</tr>, <tr>hesitate</tr>, <tr>are in doubt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:32" default="NO">12, 1, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46069.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stand still</hi> permanently, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to come to a stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">substitit ut clamor pressus gravitate regentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniumque meis substitit omne malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 196</bibl></cit>: si nihil refert, brevis an longa sit ultima, idem pes erit; <cit><quote lang="la">verum nescio quo modo sedebit hoc, illud subsistet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:94" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.14" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to A. 2. c.) <hi rend="ital">To stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be adequate to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> a thing: non si Varronis thesauros haberem, subsistere sumptui possem, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 5</bibl>: tantis periclis, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 368</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:62:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 62, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.15" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stand by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> any one (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">meis extremis aerumnis subsiste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 257, 39</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl>, p. 126, 23; 3, p. 139, 28; 5, p. 167, 9; 6, p. 174, 14. —</sense><sense id="n46069.16" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hold good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subsist</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">non eo minus sententia adversus te latā juris ratione subsistit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.17" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make resistance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut hanc esse veram religionem, cui ad vincendum tanta vis inest, aut illam falsam, quae subsistere non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 27, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46069.18" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (acc. to I. A. 2. c.), <hi rend="ital">to make a stand against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encounter</hi> any one (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">praepotentem armis Romanum subsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsitus: <entryFree id="n46070" type="hapax" key="subsi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">situated below</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convallis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsolaneus: <entryFree id="n46071" type="gloss" key="subso^la_ne^u^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsŏlānĕŭs</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-solum</etym>, <sense id="n46071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">underground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from under the earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsolaneae res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
subsolanus: <entryFree id="n46072" type="main" key="subso_la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sōlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying beneath the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eastern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oriental</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 24</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subsō-lānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ventus), <hi rend="ital">the east wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 8</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubriores septentrionales quam subsolani vel austri sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsono: <entryFree id="n46073" type="hapax" key="subso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sŏno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to express secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimate</hi>: quanti pretii (dentur), Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 175</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
subsortior: <entryFree id="n46074" type="main" key="subsorti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sortĭor</orth>, <itype>tītus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n46074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choose by lot as a substitute</hi>, sc. a judge in place of one rejected by the parties: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 35, 96</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsortiemur etiam in M. Metelli locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex lege subsortitus non erat Junius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsortitio: <entryFree id="n46075" type="main" key="subsorti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsortītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subsortior</etym>, <sense id="n46075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choosing of substitutes by lot</hi>, sc. of other judges in place of those rejected by the parties, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:61:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 61, § 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 33, 91</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">a selection of citizens to receive corn in place of those who had died: subsortitio a praetore fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subspargo: <entryFree id="n46076" type="hapax" key="subspargo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-spargo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scatter under</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina versutiis haereticorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
subspissus: <entryFree id="n46077" type="main" key="subspissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subspissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-spissus</etym>, <sense id="n46077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickish</hi>, medic. t. t.: pleureticorum pulsus, Ps.-Soran. Puls. p. 279.</sense></entryFree>
substamen: <entryFree id="n46078" type="main" key="substa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-stāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the woof</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weft</hi> in weaving (late Lat.), Vet. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
substantia: <entryFree id="n46079" type="main" key="substanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>substo</etym>, <sense id="n46079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that of which a thing consists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the being</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">material</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substance</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidae et altae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: rhetorices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de substantiā aut de qualitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singula animalia singulas habere debent substantias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse diversae substantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum pretium non in substantiā, sed in arte positum est,</quote> <trans><tr>in the material</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: delebo omnem substantiam, <hi rend="ital">every thing that exists</hi>, Vulg. <pb n="1783" /> <cb n="SUBS" /> Gen. 7, 4.—</sense><sense id="n46079.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine substantiā facultatum,</quote> <trans><tr>without store of riches</tr>, <tr>without fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substantia omnis paternorum bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Or. 19" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:16 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 16 al.</bibl>—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worldly goods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 36, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Esd. 1, 6.</sense></entryFree>
substantialis: <entryFree id="n46080" type="main" key="substanti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substantĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>substantia</etym>. <sense id="n46080.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the essence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essential</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substantial</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">differentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n46080.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">substantial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substantive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spirits</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-stantĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">essentially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substantially</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
substantialitas: <entryFree id="n46081" type="main" key="substanti^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substantĭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>substantialis</etym>, <sense id="n46081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of being substantial</hi> or <hi rend="ital">essential</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Didym. Spir. Sanc. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
substantiola: <entryFree id="n46082" type="main" key="substanti^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substantĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>substantia</etym>, <sense id="n46082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small property</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">paterna et materna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 125, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
substantivalis: <entryFree id="n46083" type="main" key="substanti_va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substantīvālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>substantivus</etym>, <sense id="n46083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">substantive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substantial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
substantivus: <entryFree id="n46084" type="main" key="substanti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substantīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>substantia</etym>, <sense id="n46084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">self-existent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substantive</hi> (post - class.). </sense><sense id="n46084.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Hermog. 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46084.2" n="II" level="1"> In gram.: substantivum verbum, <hi rend="ital">the substantive verb</hi>, i.e. sum (a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(parktiko/n</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 812 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
substerno: <entryFree id="n46085" type="main" key="substerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi> (class.; cf. subicio). </sense><sense id="n46085.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetem ovibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casias et nardi lenis aristas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 398</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 56, § 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina hordei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucum marinum,</quote> <trans><tr>to spread underneath</tr>, <tr>lay as a ground - color</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 66, § 103</bibl></cit> (syn. sublino): se (mulier), <hi rend="ital">to submit</hi>, in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 403</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">substratus Numida mortuo Romano,</quote> <trans><tr>stretched out under</tr>, <tr>lying under</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 9</bibl></cit>: pelage late substrata, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extended beneath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 619</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:411" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 411</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte lacus substratus Averni'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 746</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">natura insidians pontum substravit avaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 7, 37: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to furnish them with a couch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 93</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">male substravisse pecori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 53, § 194</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecori diligenter substernatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46085.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bestrew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">solum paleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae nidos mollissime substernunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta carbonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 14, 21, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46085.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit</hi> for examination, acceptance, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne concretum atque corporeum animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
substillus: <entryFree id="n46086" type="main" key="substillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub - stillo</etym> (ante- and post - class.), <sense id="n46086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slightly dropping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dribbling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46086.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lotium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>strangury</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46086.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">substil-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slight dropping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sprinkling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">substillum tempus ante pluviam jam paene uvidum et post pluviam non persiccum, quod jam stillaret, aut nondum desisset, Fest. pp. 306 and 307 Müll.: dehinc substillum et denuo sudum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
substituo: <entryFree id="n46087" type="main" key="substi^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-stĭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statuo</etym>. <sense id="n46087.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place next to</hi> any thing (so rare and mostly post - Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46087.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides plantae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post elephantos armaturas leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 59:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 59, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46087.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">substituerat animo speciem corporis amplam ac magnificam,</quote> <trans><tr>had presented to his imagination</tr>, <tr>figured to himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">funera fratrum Debueras oculis substituisse tuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substituebantur crimini,</quote> <trans><tr>were subjected to the charge</tr>, <tr>were accused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem arbitrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46087.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To put instead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the place of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi> (class.; syn.: suppono, subrogo). </sense><sense id="n46087.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in eorum locum cives Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontificem in locum Scipionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc pro te Verrem substituisti alterum civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69, § 161</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam tabulam pro eā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substituta fili persona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 17</bibl></cit>: philosophiam<cb n="SUBS" />  nobis pro rei publicae procuratione, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2, 7</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:58:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 58, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Siculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia semina demortuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros de oratore his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defuncto altero e consulibus, neminem substituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substituitur mutua accusatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in locis suis secunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46087.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in jurid. lang.: substituere heredem (alicui), <hi rend="ital">to make second</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alternate heir</hi>, in case the first should die: <cit><quote lang="la">heredes aut instituti dicuntur aut substituti: instituti primo gradu, substituti secundo vel tertio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 6, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredes invicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 76</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">heredem (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:9 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 9 al.</bibl>—So with ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">heredem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpuberi filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 6, 1 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
substitutio: <entryFree id="n46088" type="main" key="substi^tu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substĭtūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>substituo, II.</etym>. <sense id="n46088.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a putting in the place of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substitution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46088.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">the appointment of a second</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alternate heir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:section=174 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, § 174 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28</bibl>, tit. 6.</sense></entryFree>
substitutivus: <entryFree id="n46089" type="hapax" key="substi^tu_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substĭtūtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>substituo</etym>, <sense id="n46089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conditional</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 29, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
substitutus: <entryFree id="n46090" type="main" key="substi^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of substituo.</entryFree>
substo: <entryFree id="n46091" type="main" key="substo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n46091.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be present</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): si pure substante non rumpuntur hi tumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo dolore substante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 12, 2</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n46091.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stand firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>, = subsisto: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo, ut substet hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
substomachans: <entryFree id="n46092" type="hapax" key="substo^ma^chans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-stŏmăchans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [stomachor], <sense id="n46092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat angry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vexed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
substramen: <entryFree id="n46093" type="main" key="substra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>substerno</etym>, <sense id="n46093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">what is strewn under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">litter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:6:5" default="NO">3, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:9:8" default="NO">3, 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46093.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">supports</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubrica roboreis aderant substramina plaustris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rollers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:444" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 444</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
substramentum: <entryFree id="n46094" type="main" key="substra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">litter</hi>, = substramen, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161, 2</bibl> (al. sub stramentis).</sense></entryFree>
substratus: <entryFree id="n46095" type="main" key="substra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of substerno.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46096" type="main" key="substra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>substerno</etym>, <sense id="n46096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spreading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laying under;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
substrepens: <entryFree id="n46097" type="hapax" key="substre^pens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-strĕpens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [strepo], <sense id="n46097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">just sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just uttering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gasping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 166 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
substrictus: <entryFree id="n46098" type="main" key="substrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-strictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of substringo.</entryFree>
substridens: <entryFree id="n46099" type="hapax" key="substri_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-strīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [strido], <sense id="n46099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gnashing somewhat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
substringo: <entryFree id="n46100" type="main" key="substringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-stringo</orth>, <itype>nxi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind beneath; to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">draw up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn. subligo). </sense><sense id="n46100.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem nodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligatas auro comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 88" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lintea malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:689" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput equi loro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem fasciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46100.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw together; to draw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>: aurem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prick the ear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:433" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 433</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46100.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">effusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">substrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">drawn together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contracted;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:752" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes castorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 3, 13, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter substrictior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
substructio: <entryFree id="n46101" type="main" key="substructi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substructĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>substruo</etym>, <sense id="n46101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under - building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substructure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima debet esse cura substructionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 20, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 3:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 3, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl>; v. substruo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
substructus: <entryFree id="n46102" type="main" key="substructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">substructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of substruo.</entryFree>
substruo: <entryFree id="n46103" type="main" key="substru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to underbuild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay;</hi> lit.: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervalla montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intervalla substructis canalibus junguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus substructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=155" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 155</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolium saxo quadrato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substruendo iter facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias glareā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to lay</tr>, <tr>to pave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: non alte substruitur, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> <cb n="SUBT" /> <hi rend="ital">foundation is not laid deeply</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6, 5</bibl>. —<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">substructum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = substructio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subsultim: <entryFree id="n46104" type="hapax" key="subsultim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsultim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>subsilio</etym>, <sense id="n46104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jumps.</hi> decurrere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subsulto: <entryFree id="n46105" type="main" key="subsulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsulto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n46105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to spring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hop</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n46105.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu subsultas, ego miser vix asto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46105.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sermo subsultet imparibus spatiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio multis clausulis concisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsum: <entryFree id="n46106" type="main" key="subsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sum</orth>, no <sense id="n46106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>esse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to be under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">behind; to be near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi non subest, quo praecipitet ac decidat,</quote> <trans><tr>there is nothing underneath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 873</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1082</bibl>: si quid intra cutem subest ulceris, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subucula subest tunicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra subest lingua palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 388</bibl></cit>: suberat Pan ilicis umbrae <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sol Oceano subest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46106.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be at hand</hi>, of places and persons: <cit><quote lang="la">mons suberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planities,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina taberna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 359</bibl></cit>; cf.: regnum Ariobarzanis illi, Sall. Ep. Mithrid. ad Arsac. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: me subesse propinquis locis, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46106.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">to be near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox jam suberat,</quote> <trans><tr>was near</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 97</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies comitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46106.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be at the bottom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exist under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie concealed in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (legatione) periculi suspitio non subesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā re nulla subesset suspitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply suspitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 21, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem causa subest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa aliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si his vitiis ratio non subesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 28, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si negabimus temere famam Naxi solere, quin subsit aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ulla spes salutis nostrae subesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam illi regi amabili, Cyro, subest ad inmutandi animi licentiam crudelissimus ille Phalaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe solent auro multa subesse mala,</quote> <trans><tr>are hid under</tr>, <tr>exist under</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subest silentio facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">notitiae suberit amica tuae,</quote> <trans><tr>will be subject to your cognizance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 398</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subsummo: <entryFree id="n46107" type="main" key="subsummo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-summo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-summa</etym>, <sense id="n46107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sum up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to multiply</hi> (late Lat.), Primas in Apoc. V. 21.</sense></entryFree>
subsurdus: <entryFree id="n46108" type="main" key="subsurdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-surdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat deaf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>indistinct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit> Halm. (al. surda).</sense></entryFree>
subsutura: <entryFree id="n46109" type="main" key="subsu_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subsūtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-suo</etym>, <sense id="n46109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hem</hi> of a garment, Edict. Diocl. 7, n. c. 49.</sense></entryFree>
subsutus: <entryFree id="n46110" type="hapax" key="subsu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-sūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [suo], <sense id="n46110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sewn beneath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the lower part</hi>: vestis, <hi rend="ital">trimmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edged</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fringed at the bottom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtabidus: <entryFree id="n46111" type="hapax" key="subta_bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tābĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat shrunken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stetit subtabidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtacitus: <entryFree id="n46112" type="hapax" key="subta^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tăcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtalaris: <entryFree id="n46113" type="main" key="subta_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tālāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-talus</etym>, <sense id="n46113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying under the heel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 34, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtectio: <entryFree id="n46114" type="main" key="subtecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-tego</etym>, <sense id="n46114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Heptat. 2:177:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Heptat. 2, 177, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtegmen: <entryFree id="n46115" type="main" key="subtegmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtegmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. subtemen.</entryFree>
subtego: <entryFree id="n46116" type="main" key="subte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 7, 3</bibl></cit> (al. sub-texunt); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra ipsum subtexisse jaculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub avis caudā pedes equi sunt subtecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: subtecto nubibus caelo, Hilar. in Psa. 146, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Heptat. 2:177:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Heptat. 2, 177, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtegulaneus: <entryFree id="n46117" type="hapax" key="subte^gu^la_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tĕgŭlānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tegula</etym>, <sense id="n46117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is under the roof</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">in-doors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 61, § 185</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtel: <entryFree id="n46118" type="gloss" key="subtel"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtel</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">to\ koi=lon tou= podo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n46118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hollow of the foot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 644</bibl> P. [sub-talus].</sense></entryFree>
subtemen: <entryFree id="n46119" type="main" key="subte_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtēmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subtegmen</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from subteximen, subtecmen, from sub-texo</etym>, <sense id="n46119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is wrought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">woven in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the woof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weft</hi> of a web: <cit><quote lang="la">inseritur medium radiis subtemen acutis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=113" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 113</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 483</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl>; <pb n="1784" /> <cb n="SUBT" /> 13, 12, 24, § 79.—</sense><sense id="n46119.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">any thing spun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yarn</hi> (rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">subtemen tenue nere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Nep. Am. 2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Nep. Am. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:121" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:656" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 656</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picto bracae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:227" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">croceo vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 234</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">threads</hi> of the Fates: <cit><quote lang="la">unde tibi reditum certo subtemine Parcae Rupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere subtemina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyg. 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtendo: <entryFree id="n46120" type="main" key="subtendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tendo</orth>, no <sense id="n46120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>tum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n46120.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectos loris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 25</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n46120.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Expos. Form. p. 32" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Expos. Form. p. 32</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
subteneo: <entryFree id="n46121" type="hapax" key="subte^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tĕnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinaceos lectos cestibus subtento (contr. for subteneto),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subtentus: <entryFree id="n46122" type="main" key="subtentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from subtendo.</entryFree>
subtenuis: <entryFree id="n46123" type="hapax" key="subte^nu^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tĕnŭis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thinnish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">setae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subter: <entryFree id="n46124" type="main" key="subter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">supter</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>sub</etym>. <sense id="n46124.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi>: navem in fugam transdunt subter saxa, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155, 8</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 630 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">terram fac ut esse rearis Subter item, ut supera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim quod supter per terras diditur omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam naturam supter habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia haec, quae supra et subter, unum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 106: anulus subter adhaerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:914" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 914</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum subter premere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subter mediam fere regionem sol obtinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterius (opp. superius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46124.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n46124.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatem subter praecordia locavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subter pineta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 67: <cit><quote lang="la">subter fastigia tecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere vias subter mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subter imas cavernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu subter togam exserta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super subterque terram pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 4</bibl></cit>: subter murum hostium ad cohortes advehitur, <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">close to the walls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo Italiae subter radices (Alpium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:711" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 711</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46124.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhoeteo subter litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subter densā testudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 514</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46124.4" n="III" level="1"> In composition, subter, like sub, denotes <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>: subteractus, subterfluo, etc.; and also, transf., <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clandestinely</hi>: subterduco, subterfugio. It is sometimes doubtful whether subter forms a compound with a verb, or is an adverb qualifying it.</sense></entryFree>
subteractus: <entryFree id="n46125" type="hapax" key="subte^ractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtĕr-actus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ago], <sense id="n46125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">driven below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subteractis quasi radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subteranhelo: <entryFree id="n46126" type="hapax" key="subtera^nhe_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-ănhēlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gasp beneath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtercavatus: <entryFree id="n46127" type="hapax" key="subterca^va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-căvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [cavo], <sense id="n46127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hollowed out underneath</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subtercurrens: <entryFree id="n46128" type="hapax" key="subtercurrens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-currens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n46128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moving underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basim Vergiliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtercutaneus: <entryFree id="n46129" type="main" key="subtercu^ta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-cŭtānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cutis</etym>, <sense id="n46129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beneath the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subcutaneous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>the dropsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 14" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterduco: <entryFree id="n46130" type="main" key="subterdu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry off secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steal away</hi> any thing (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne tibi clam se subterducat istinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si huic occasioni tempus sese subterduxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterfluo: <entryFree id="n46131" type="main" key="subterflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-flŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow beneath</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n46131.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis sub montes subterfluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrente subterfluente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 4</bibl></cit>, acc. to Fickert and Haase (not subinfluo).—</sense><sense id="n46131.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos felicitas ingrata subterfluit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterfugio: <entryFree id="n46132" type="main" key="subterfu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46132.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee secretly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by stealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get off</hi> (so very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">subterfugisse sic mihi hodie Chrysalum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:6:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 6, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46132.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shun</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite word of Cic.): mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim criminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprudentiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 26, 97</bibl></cit>: poenam aut calamitatem,<cb n="SUBT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 34, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quasi fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatem Punici belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus fisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 6:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterfugium: <entryFree id="n46133" type="main" key="subterfu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subterfŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>subterfugio</etym>, <sense id="n46133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subterfuge</hi>: Nestorianorum, Facund. Defens. 1, 3.</sense></entryFree>
subterfundo: <entryFree id="n46134" type="hapax" key="subterfundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-fundo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to found</hi> or <hi rend="ital">establish beneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterinsero: <entryFree id="n46135" type="main" key="subte^rinse^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtĕr-insĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to insert</hi>, Aldh. Sept. col. 219, t. 89 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subterintendo: <entryFree id="n46136" type="main" key="subte^rintendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtĕr-intendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look askance</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(poble/pein</foreign> (Appul.), Polem. Physiogn. p. 126.</sense></entryFree>
subterior: <entryFree id="n46137" type="main" key="subte^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, <sense id="n46137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> [subter], <hi rend="ital">that is farther beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, = inferior (late Lat.): termini, Innoc. Cas. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 232 Goes.: <cit><quote lang="la">per subteriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0923,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Aem. Mac.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subtĕrĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterius nigro, superius mineo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterjaceo: <entryFree id="n46138" type="hapax" key="subterja^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-jăcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie under</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">hic gens ardentem caeli subterjacet axem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 1, 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterjacio: <entryFree id="n46139" type="hapax" key="subterja^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-jăcĭo</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw under</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">hordei grana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterlabor: <entryFree id="n46140" type="main" key="subterla_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-lābor</orth>, <itype>lābi</itype>, <sense id="n46140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46140.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow under</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus Sicanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina subterlabentia muros,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing close by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterlabens Mosella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46140.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to slip away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritate subterlabentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25</bibl></cit> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
subterlino: <entryFree id="n46141" type="hapax" key="subterli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-lĭno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to anoint underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas aegri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterluo: <entryFree id="n46142" type="hapax" key="subterlu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-lŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flow underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurgite sidereo subterluit Oriona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterluvio: <entryFree id="n46143" type="hapax" key="subterlu^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subterlŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subterluo</etym>, <sense id="n46143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">washing away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca umoris assidui subterluvione cadentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
